purpose.p: The risk_schema identifies risks as they are perceived each with their probability and consequences pertaining to events or situations.

inscope.li: identification and representation of a risk;
representation of the relationships between risks;
identification and representation of the perception of a risk;
representation of the relationships between perceptions of risks;
representation of the context of the risk and risk perception;
assignment and representation of the probability or likelihood of the risk;
representation of the consequence of the risk;
representation of a risk criteria;
representation of a risk treatment and its primary and secondary mitigation objectives;
representation of a risk reduction and the mitigation objectives it resolves;
representation of a risk evaluation;
representation of the risk identification process;
representation of the source identification process;
representation of the risk analysis process;
representation of the risk assessment process;
representation of the risk control process;
representation of the risk estimation process;
representation of the risk communication process;
representation of the impact of the risk, if any;
assignment of any items impacted by the risk;
representation of the status a risk possesses;
assignment of an owner to risk;
assignment of the source of risk;
assignment of resources for risk activities;
representation of a risk resource and its usage;
assignment of classification information to risk data;
representation of a risk stakeholder;
communication of risk data between stakeholders.

outscope.li: process to develop a risk management system.

introduction.p: The risk_schema identifies a by specifying the outcome or consequence of an event and the associated probability for the occurrence of that event and the specified outcome. Details of risk analysis such as modelling of accident development or detailed consequence calculations are not included in the risk_schema
A can describe the concern at hand which may be related to more than one event with more than one possible outcome or consequence.

Risk is always present and more than one perception of a is possible. The representation of a these perceptions describe a in a particular context along with the probability of an event and its corresponding consequence or consequences.
The specifies risk sources, i.e. items or activities having a potential for consequences that might be subject to further analysis and assessment.

A source of is not limited to events but may apply to products, people, organizations, or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this resource part that have the potential for generating risks of general uncertainty.

fund_cons.p: A can be determinately identified by a set of recognisable assessments or perceptions that can be used to distinguish all relevant possible outcomes.
In this part of ISO 10303 such a perception is recorded as an instance of the entity.
